intro: Retinispora formosensis, commonly known as the Taiwan retinispora, is a species of flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along forest floors or in rocky crevices. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, winged seeds, which aid in wind dispersal. Retinispora formosensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
